grade: Jōyō kanji, taught in junior high
on reading compounds: 丹念【タンネン】painstaking, careful, meticulous, scrupulous, detailed, elaborate
丹精【タンセイ】working earnestly, sincerity, diligence, effort, pains
切支丹【キリシタン】early Japanese Christianity (from the later Muromachi period), early Japanese Christian
kun reading compounds: 丹【に】red earth (i.e. containing cinnabar or minium), vermilion
海胆【うに】sea urchin, seasoned sea urchin eggs
黄丹【おうだん】orange color traditionally worn by the crown prince
